title: McDonald Hopkins to host Oct. 29 event: Leaving a legacy - Supporting the future of your family
text:
McDonald Hopkins
CLEVELAND , Oct. 22, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Planning for family harmony often takes a back seat to other estate planning subjects, such as estate taxes, control of property, and related income tax issues. Instead, potential family matters should also be addressed during the estate planning process.
That's why McDonald Hopkins LLC is hosting a Business Hour on Thursday, October 29 : Leaving a legacy: Supporting the future of your family. The program is from Noon to 1:00 p.m. EDT at the firm's Cleveland office; and will also be broadcast live via webcast for those who cannot attend in person. Panelists for the discussion will include attorneys from our estate planning practice: Roger L. Shumaker , Chair; Katherine Esshaki Wensink , Of Counsel, and Michael P. Witzke , Member. The program is free of charge.
Topics will include:
Passing your values and valuables to family and charity Uncomfortable conversations Resolving issues to ensure harmony Should you have a family meeting? Registration is available on the McDonald Hopkins' website . Registration for the live webcast is available here .
About McDonald Hopkins
Founded in 1930, McDonald Hopkins is a business advisory and advocacy law firm with locations in Chicago , Cleveland , Columbus , Detroit , Miami , and West Palm Beach . Our subsidiary, McDonald Hopkins Government Strategies LLC, is based in Washington, D.C. and led by former Congressman Steven LaTourette . McDonald Hopkins Government Strategies is not a law firm and does not provide legal services. For more information about McDonald Hopkins , visit mcdonaldhopkins.com .
